CatDescriptText: Mr. B. Wolfe, retired shoe repairman, Roosevelt Hotel, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "They should report to the state just how they have spent the money and in this way it will keep the persons from spending it on such things like booze."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of B. Wolfe wearing plaid jacket with paper flower, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
